title: We're the team behind the Community Beta, Ask Us Anything!
body:
Hey guys, I'm MoltovCarrot, UX Designer on the Community Beta team. I'm here with Pendragon and Krylhos, and we're here to answer any questions you have about the new Community Beta platform.

For more info, check out Pendragon's details: http://community.na.leagueoflegends.com/c/community-beta/bZadA5Pg-welcome-to-the-community-beta

Bring it on!

replies.body: Can i touch you?..
I checked with my wife. She says no.

What are thoughts about this platform being part of the game client? If the goal is to make this platform community driven and put players together to talk, it seems to me that implementing this as part of the game client would be better. (since all players need the game client at one time or another... to, ya' know... play)

I understand that that would take much more resources and time to deploy and maintain, so that probably wouldn't be an immediate thing.

There's a reason we're calling this a "community platform" and not just a "community website" ;)

However, when making any product decisions and allocating resources to making them happen, we never worry about "can we?", but rather "should we?" and then if we decide "we should" then we have to weigh "how soon?" to do it relative to all the other things we could be doing to make your community experience better.

How will you guys be monitoring the bullying and toxic community with this new platform?  The last general discussion as you can easily see became so toxic for every little thing
Such player location
To ranking
To simple just bullying

One of the major goals of the new platform is greater community stewardship. In other words, while we will delete the absolute worst offenses, in general the voting mechanic will help each sub-comunity to self-moderate as well.
Interesting, our summoner icons show up.  I didn't realize that stewardship included small pictures, but I like it!
What are the pros of using this over Reddit?
RedTracker.
Traffic stays at their site and can be integrated in various ways depending on their platform demands/player response.

I'd really like to see the implementation of tags to posts.  Sub-forums are nice, but when you really want to get specific, being able to search by tags is extremely useful.  

For example, if you were interested in finding discussions for Heimerdinger you could tag search Heimerdinger and Champion Discussion. 

Tags could be made for items, champions, teams, topics, community creations like art, music, stories, etc.  Topic Tags would help Summoners get to the information they wanted quickly, and would provide a potential spark of interest when Summoners search a tag just to see what its about.

Oh, that's a cool idea. There have been times where I've wanted to search some information on champion changes and discussions on them to get player perspectives, but had trouble finding it. You're a hero in my eyes. TAKE ALL OF MY UP-VOTES.
Can I still rant and rave how Katarina has been overnerfed and Lee Sin is more toxic to LoL than Kat ever was?  This is important.
You can rant about whatever you want. There's no guarantees that folks will agree with you though ;)

Your discussion is more likely to be seen if your rant and rave is a well-constructed argument that gets a lot of votes from your peers and invites dialog. If that still counts as a rant, then by all means, doo eeet.

I love this system, great job guys! The voting system is a brilliant addition.

One complaint though! PLEASE! Please, give Rioters the avatars they're known for. I can barely recognize you guys now! XD
It's on the to do list. Fear not.
Would it be possible to have a way of tracking a thread other than posting or bookmarking it? Such as a "Like/Favorite" button or something along those lines.
We have some ideas. I'd love to know how this system would be useful to you.

I always find myself needing to dig up red posts, and they can get buried in a matter of hours if a megathread happens. I usually have to rely on a search engine, and those are unreliable. A way to bookmark posts and being able to search through the bookmarked posts quickly would be greatly helpful to someone like me.

Thanks for the quick reply.

Check out our new Red Tracker ( http://community.na.leagueoflegends.com/redtracker ). We've also built a robust built-in search system that we will be improving on over time.

Let me know if those seem like they will serve your needs, and if not, I'd love to know where they fall short. It will help us inform our strategy moving forward.

I'm not sure they will, because when I do have to search, I usually have to think of some phrase in the post. If there's a big post on, say, Lucian and a designer explains the entire design process on Lucian's Q, I want to bookmark that post for later if anyone else ever asks about that design, maybe MONTHS later. Currently, I have to either make it a Chrome Bookmark and put it in the LoL folder which is hard to navigate, or I have to search something like "Lucian Q Design" and trawl through the immense amount of threads using those words over the past months to find the one I'm looking for. THEN, in that thread, I have to look through all the Red posts (which can get to a high amount when talking design) for the ONE red post that explains it all and hope that it's one of the first Red posts. An integrated bookmark system, however, is pretty much the perfect system for collecting important LoL information from reds and any other posters on the forums.

Ask yourself: when designing more features in the future for this new community beta, several hours, days, weeks, or months from now, how are you going to find this post?

Wall of Text crits for 5000 boatloads of damage.

Any plans on adding stat tracking systems to player's profiles?  Many forums track your post count, thread creation count, etc.  Reddit has 'karma' which tracks your upvotes?  I think?  Anyway I enjoy stuff like that, so where do you Rioters see player profiles going?

(And by profiles I mean the profiles unique to this community site when I click on a poster's name).

We love stats. We especially love stats that mean something, (like indicators of peoples contributions).

That being said - I want to be careful to not commit to anything that we're not prepared to shortly follow-up with delivery, so while that's something I think would be awesome to have - I have no clue if it's coming or not :).

OK!  For what it's worth, I would categorize profile statistics in this way:

1) You can show the community you've been involved for a while.

Account created date -- Post count -- Season 1/2/3 standings

2) You can show the community that you're active.

Post count -- Thread creation / view count -- Games played

3) You can show the community that you're helpful.

Number of upvotes your posts have received -- Tie ins with your new system for mentoring players

4) You can show off your in game skill to the community

Season 1/2/3 standings -- Current elo/division.


Just a quick list, and thx for the response!
Are you guys auto deleting "first" posts? I'm surprised that this thing isn't full of them. I mean first post on the subcommunity itself would be like the holy grail to those people, right?

I think you're just early to the party. =c) I'm sure we'll see them, but "first" is vestigial to vBulletin's discussion structure. Being first isn't really relevant on a platform like this, but being best is.
Shhhh! Do not mention them!! It is how they are summoned

[Feedback]
A couple of questions with regards to UX decisions in the overall layout of the page. 

1. What's the reasoning behind the narrow fixed width? The left-hand column that lets us jump between subcommunities is incredibly useful, but it eats up a ton of space that was previously filled with content on previous forums. Because the content is restricted to a 620px column (down from 740 on the old site) it feels like there's a lot more vertical stretch. 

2. This is definitely more feedback than a question, but what drove the heavy use of italic text for the timestamp and topic fields of the Red Tracker? It ends up making it very hard to read, and at least for the particular way I use the Red Tracker, obfuscates the most important pieces of information (the topic where the post is being made). 

3. The scroll bar in the preview window  behaves somewhat inconsistently when making a post, and the real-time preview will often end up not tracking the cursor at all. Would it be possible to ensure that when data is being entered in the editing field, the new data is always visible? [Replication case - enter a longer post like this one, then scroll midway (such that you've made a change to where you're viewing, but the new content will be visible). Keep typing, and the new text in the preview window will scroll out rather than following what you're typing.]

Thanks for putting this together and answering our questions. It's always a pleasure seeing the extent of your interaction with the community.

Hey Wodin,

  1. Fixed width is likely a stop-gap solution that gets the new community platform matched with the rest of the site theme. However, we are exploring a number of responsive solutions and you will likely see changes to the layout over time as we study usage and experiment. If you have a great idea, feel free to start a new discussion.
  2. We went back and forth with the treatment of that. We want to make sure that the metadata on a post is visually distinct from the actual comment contents. However, I am very sensitive to readability issues, so if you are seeing a problem I would love to take a look. Do you mind posting a screenshot of what the italics look like on your system?
  3. Yep, thanks for the report on this. We're aware of a couple issues with the live preview, and I we're tracking any bugs we see. More eyes always helps [fist bump]

Spiffy, good to know that the width is mostly temp! I don't have any easy solve, it was just a very jarring transition and I personally do much better with horizontal content than heavily verticals. 

With regard to #2, here's a screenshot (http://i.imgur.com/V01B8Ea.png) of what it looks like for me. The particularly jarring bits are the two different sizes of italic font right next to each other [the timestamp and the subject) and the fact that the subject is lighter than the timestamp, so my eyes are drawn to the timestamp first despite it being subjectively a much less important piece of information. 

My personal preference would promote the subject up into the space currently occupied by Show Parent so there was a clear, visually delineated space where the subject was always going to be, and then using a darker, bolded font. I faked a quick prototype (http://i.imgur.com/lF8YWaQ.png) that is obviously pretty hideous but should convey the idea.

Ooh testing how posting new comments work.
And is this by chance an implementation of wave or similar to an implementation of wave? Will you guys be adding anything along the lines of special content in messages like posting in-game items, masteries, rune pages, etc. like on the Path of Exile Forums?

Great question, 

We will definitely be bringing more in-game content  (such as items, champion references, etc) to create a more rich posting experience.
Such as posting a guide/build that doesn't mean I have to go to another website, (like mobafire, etc)? That would be rad.
Sorry if I sound a bit harsh when saying this, but why bother making this when reddit already exists? This looks very much like a reddit clone.
"Why try to draw traffic back to your own site rather than to a third party?"

To be frank, I don't see this overtaking reddit in popularity and therefore think that this might all just turn out to be a waste of company resources.

I guess a better question would have been: Why should I use this over using Reddit?
We have built a platform that we can build on for the future. The functionality we can build on top of this system far exceed what we could do on a third party site.
Care to provide some examples? I'm very interested to see what this platform can do and what ideas you guys have for it.

Because Red Tracker. Also, I wouldn't be surprised if this helps make the forum community less toxic. In my experience the honor system made life a lot better. Despite the often terrible community I've been very impressed with Riot as a company in their attempts to battle toxicity.

The goal of this is not to overtake Reddit, but rather to provide a solid experience when you want to engage with the community.  

I would hope you would use this community to help shape it into the best experience it can be!

Any plans to feature some of the best conversations, maybe as legit News items?  I imagine it's hard for the "average" League of Legends player to keep up with what's evolving outside of the Patch Preview videos.  Could be a good warehouse for important questions (i.e., Morello thought-dumps) that are asked far, far too frequently.

you did exactly what i was hoping you would do. Why the removal of the off topic sub forum. many of the threads made in general discussion now usually fit in there and with its removal those threads will not have a good home.
I feel like one thing I require is that Rioters get their signature avatars on the new forums. It can't be as good if Iron Stylus doesn't have his parrot!

Parrot OP. We had to nerf it.

In all seriousness, it's early days yet. I would also like to get the custom rioter avatars back, or something like them. Right now we're focusing on core platform issues though.
i just want to say this is beautiful and im proud to support riot and run a comapany that has the same morals of these rioters
http://imgur.com/gallery/EsLssoD
seems like your gif is busted bazner. or at least i get a weird zooming artifact on it.

Can we please get personal avatars and the ability to find our own posts and responses in this new system? It sad that we still all have question marks, and finding your own stuff is almost impossible on the forums; even searching your user name often doesn't bring things up.

EDIT: when I say personal avatar, I mean something we pick, not just our in-game icon, which is shared with thousands of other players.

EDIT 2: Never mind about the post tracker, I just found it in the profile. THANK YOU!! But my point on personal avatars stands.

I cant tell who's talking to who, it's impossible to have a prolonged discussion.. I would be scared to see how some of the Xelnath or Irtonstylus threads would would look on this style of "community" What the hell is with this crap about being the best? Umm just to point out the obvious only one person can be the best so you guys are effectively designing this whole thing for one person. Sounds exciting.

Following in this format is going to lead to people simply copying everything back and forth from reddit. 

Also this preview thing is creepy as fuck. I can see what I'm typing  I dont need it being mirrored back at me like someone is watching me.
